channel.title: Portforward
channel.description:
I've got some experience with making servers, but when I try to portforward, canyouseeme.org isn't saying that my port is open.
On my router webpage, it shows this:
[b]Application:[/b] RSPS [b]Start:[/b] 43594 [b]End:[/b] 43594 [b]Protocol:[/b] Both [b]IP Address:[/b] 192.168.1. [101] [b]Enable:[/b] [x]
When I do IPConfig /all, it says that my IP is 192.168.1.101. I can't do 192.168.1.1 because that's the router webpage or whatever. I'm guessing that I'm putting the wrong last number in for the IP address box. I DID follow the steps on the portforward website. Any help? Thanks.

item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @mikeyboy09 mikeyboy09
item.description:
@mikeyboy09 wrote:

for the ip you got to use your IPv4
cmd and type ipconfig and it should be there
IPv4 Address. . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.0.3

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @staticfish1 staticfish1
item.description:
@staticfish1 wrote:

You have to be running the server when you check if its open. The server is what allows things like canyouseeme to connect. Constantly run run.bat or runserver.bat while you check it.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“ThaNamesRyan, post:3, topic:398816”][quote author=Java Is My Bitch link=topic=495952.msg3625890#msg3625890 date=1307830756]
Make sure you’ve restarted your router and you applied the settings. It’ looks fine to me.
[/quote]

Yeah, everythings saved, it’s enabled. When I try to check the port, it still says closed.[/quote]Have you opened the ports on your firewall?

Read full topic

item.description:
@ThaNamesRyan wrote:

Java Is My Bitch:

Make sure you’ve restarted your router and you applied the settings. It’ looks fine to me.

Yeah, everythings saved, it’s enabled. When I try to check the port, it still says closed.

item.title: Portforward
item.dc:creator: @ThaNamesRyan ThaNamesRyan
item.description:
@ThaNamesRyan wrote:

I’ve got some experience with making servers, but when I try to portforward, canyouseeme.org isn’t saying that my port is open.

On my router webpage, it shows this:

Application: RSPS
Start: 43594
End: 43594
Protocol: Both
IP Address: 192.168.1. [101]
Enable: [x]

When I do IPConfig /all, it says that my IP is 192.168.1.101. I can’t do 192.168.1.1 because that’s the router webpage or whatever. I’m guessing that I’m putting the wrong last number in for the IP address box. I DID follow the steps on the portforward website.
Any help? Thanks.

Read full topic
